alert.note: Alert for Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 07 at 9:41PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of western Addison County in Vermont. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from current rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 938 PM EDT, Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen today. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bridport, Addison, Shoreham, Panton, Ferrisburgh, Orwell, Kingsland Bay State Park, Plumies Point, Giards Bay, West Bridport, Kings Bay State Park, Kingsland Bay, Stevens Bay and Benson Bay. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
